caption:
The photograph showcases a middle-aged man, likely a ship officer based on his attire, casually leaning on a railing aboard a ship. He is dressed in a light khaki uniform with a matching peaked cap adorned with a badge, suggesting his official role on the ship. His expression is relaxed and contemplative, with a slightly furrowed brow, as he gazes directly at the camera.

In front of him, there is a life-ring attached to the railing, prominently labeled "VILLA VELEBITA PULA," indicating the name of the ship and possibly its home port. The life-ring is weathered, with visible signs of wear and discoloration, hinting at exposure to the elements and frequent use.

The background behind the officer is slightly out of focus, featuring a portion of the ship's structure, including elements like white railings and a vertical pole, which all contribute to a maritime ambiance. The sky overhead is overcast, giving the scene a muted, soft light that enhances the subdued color palette of the image.

Overall, the composition of the photograph, with the officer centered and framed by maritime elements, clearly conveys a sense of his environment and role aboard the ship. The image captures a moment of quiet amidst the responsibilities of life at sea.
title: The Vila Velebita II, research ship of the Ruder Boskovic Institute, is partially supported by EPA funds.
